intro: Senecio incomptus, commonly known as the narrowleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a clustered inflorescence. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Senecio incomptus is adapted to survive in harsh environments, with a deep root system that helps it conserve water.
